profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 15:24:12 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Papers of curator Herschel Browning Chipp concern the provenance, conservation, publication and exhibition of the painting "Washington rallying the troops at Monmouth," 1854, by Emanuel Gottlieb Leutze, owned by the University of California, Berkeley, University Art Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: correspondence, research notes, press releases, newsclippings, photographs, conservation reports, and 2 unpublished manuscripts, "Washington at Monmouth" by John D. Hicks, and "Emanuel Leutze's Mural Westward the Course of Empire Takes Us Way" by Justin G. Turner, and documents regarding the program and budget for the 1965 exhibition of the Leutze painting.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 3098-3099. Available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to lender after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Art historian, writer, museum curator, and educator; Berkeley, Calif. Born 1913. Died 1992.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1984 by Herschel Browning Chipp.

controlaccess.corpname: University of California, Berkeley. University Art Museum
